caption: I got the ital dinner (stew, cabbage, rice & peas) and the sea moss drink made with coconut milk and it was all delicious. Wish there was more chikn in my stew though. What one reviewer described as bland I'd describe as clean flavors; the drink was not milkshake sweet; the dinner had all your classic flavors without saltiness we often equate with flavor. If I'm ever back in the city I hope to try the lentil patties--they were (not surprisingly) sold out.
The food is constantly fresh and delicious, cashiers hands out great customer service. I like the cleanliness and vibes. I highly recommend this spot.

The service was terrible, no utensils, bad service, bland ital food..definitely not worth the the money spent..customer service from the daughter  was terrible..terrible Ital food Rasta...Don't waste money Roots..

I absolutely recommend Sweet Sosumba!! Their food is healthy and delicious. I had The Remix, with the two entrees being Jerk "chicken" and curry "chicken" with steamed cabbage and brown rice and peas, also a side of plantain crisps and avocado slices.... contrary to what I expected, the food wasn't highly processed, and the flavor of the sea moss smoothie reminded me of horchata. I plan on ordering from them again 💯
So so good! The curry chickpeas and jerk “chicken” were amazing. I’m happy to have found a new veg option!

I guess the food is good aslong as you don't go when time to close...no customer service what soever i ordered the curry chicken coconut rice and peas my food was cold and dry no fork or napkins I asked the lady for some gravy on my food she say no we don't have any and shuts the door in my face. Im traveling from atl passing threw and decide to stop and get food a friend recommended this spot to me its the customer service  and the food for me I will never come again no sir! Take ya money and treat you rude as this food is!
WOWOWOW words cannot describe how delicious the food was. And service was incredible
Got the curry chick’n: it was very dry and and the cabbage was more flavorful than the curry. Very disappointing.
Tho I came during the covid lock down and could not the full experience, the food was good. Cant wait to try more when I come in town again

The food I ordered was absolutely delicious with just the right amount of spicy for me.  The portions were generous.  The delivery was efficient; there was a little confusion regarding the address but the driver quickly corrected it and was very courteous, as well.

This place is unreal. Not only is the food consistently amazing and super rich, the women who run the place are genuinely kind and go out of their way to make you feel welcome. I’d recommend this place to anyone and everyone coming to my neighborhood.
Fantastic Ital food. My new neighborhood spot.
Perfect takeout-lunch surprise for my vegan-craving valentine ♥️😋
Amazing! That’s all I can say. Everything tasted so good. My non-vegan husband loved it!
Authentic food. Authentic people. Just made my day sweeter. Food was infused with love.
username: My Sacred Living Temple Shah Khan

caption: Love it! The restaurant is clean music an environment is uplifting. Not to mention the fresh and ital food and drinks they serve.
Ok.
The food was bland with no flavor what so ever then they gave me such a tiny portion I will stick with my own home cooking Nu Vegan is better the food has more flavor
Food and beverages taste great. They have a selection of a few different hot herbal teas, fresh juices & smoothies, and soy-free and gluten-free options.
Wonderful vibes great tasting food
Good food, comfy atmosphere, and friendly staff
Quaint, relaxing vibes, wonderful variety of food and juices. Appreciate the artwork and cleanliness.

AMAZING FOOD! I had the remix with jerk “chicken,” and curry chickpeas. And a large Irish Moss. I honestly didn’t expect the food to be that good... or that spicy. Exactly what I love. The atmosphere was clean. The Irish moss even had a metal straw. I will defiantly be back. What a time to be into plant based foods right now!
Tried this place already with a friend and I am addicted since then. I like the fantastic character and yummy food and drinks. Kudos.
First time trying Vegan and this place was great.
Great food & service, definitely will go there again
Food taste great. Plantain fries taste like fries
This place is amazing.  The vibe is great and the food is off the charts!  My new favorite lunch spot!

I thought I knew of all the great vegan spots in the DC area, but so much has changed since I’ve returned. I found this place upon doing a search, and was very excited to try the food, and was definitely not disappointed. Lightly flavored with coconut and oh so good. I will be back to try the other menu items very soon!
Great

I had a very good experience at Sweet Sosumba Cafe. I ordered the Jerk Ital Stew and a Mango Pineapple smoothie. I loved the fact that it's cooked the traditional way. Ital. No added salt just natural herbs and spices so you can add as much/little salt and pepper to your liking. There was nice roots dub playing and it just felt cozy and nice. Loy (I hoped I spelled it right😊) and I had very pleasant talk about back home and how times have changed (good and bad) I was full so I took my smoothie home to my 7yo who gave it a big thumbs up 👍🏾. Needless to say I will be back. Good vibes✨

I had never had Jamaican food before and I'm so glad I found this vegan Jamaican food. The employee was extremely helpful on the Phone when I got lost driving there, and when my group arrived they were so helpful as we figured out what we wanted to eat. They had extremely prompt service and got our food to us very quickly. I have the highest recommendation of this establishment! The only thing is if you have a bigger group, they do have limiting seating, only a few tables and they're 2-3 seaters. Not a bad thing, just something to be aware of.
This was some of the best vegan food I have ever had and the sweetest staff!

I was looking for a place where I could eat safely and happily as a dairy-allergic celiac, and this place is it! The owner/chef was WONDERFUL about accommodating my celiac -- fried up plantains for me in clean oil in a dedicated pan! Loved it all. Definitely going back.

Service was excellent food was not that great. Whatever entree you order underneath is a crunchy like Pattie with either jerk sauce or curry sauce on it. Sorrel tasted like unsweetened tea. The best part of the meal was the plantains. The woman working was very helpful and attentive.

Do your mind, body, and soul a favor and come to Sweet Sosumba! The food is full of the authentic flavor of 🇯🇲 that I grew up with.  Every menu item is unique and made fresh and your sure to be hooked after just one bite!
OMG ! great food great place good music.

Visiting from out-of-state and walked over a mile to this spot - SO WORTH IT! The women are sweet and the food was incredibly delicious. I enjoyed the ital stew which was full of robust flavor and carribean jerk spice with a side dish of sweet friend plantains topped with avocado. So so good! I only wish I was in town long enough to celebrate at their 1 year anniversary party on June 16th!
Great food !

Finally, good vegan Jamaican!! Eating at Sweet Sosumba is like eating at your best friend's mom's house. Every dish is freshly prepared and served on dishware that makes you feel like you could settle in for the afternoon if you had to. The flavors of the food are wonderful and spicy. I didn't have a chance to talk to the owners but from everything I've read and heard they're some of the friendliest in the neighborhood. The jerk chicken with beans and rice is one of my favorite comfort dishes in DC and I can't wait to go back to try the others.
Love their food, and they are so wonderful
Great vegan food. The spicy is really spicy.

My experience today was disheartening. I really wanted to support this establishment. The food is HORRIBLE and was a total waste of money ($15) and time. I got the jerk ital stew. ZERO flavor with 95% of the dish being canned kidney beans. Don't waste your time unless you're just practicing UMJAMAA. *Really zero stars...

Sweet Sosumba far exceeded my expectations. I dined in on a late Sunday afternoon and chose from the brunch menu. I ordered the callaloo and lentil stew and sweet plantains, my mate ordered the jerk chkn and pineapple ginger, and his friend had the chickpea burger. We were all knocked off or feet by the flavors. The cook (who was so sweet and helpful) had allowed us to have a sample of the stew and the meek sauce, but the meal really brought all the flavors together. My mate would have thrown in a few more sthat's if possible lol. Needless to say, we will definitely be coming back and telling friends!
Great ambiance, chill atmosphere and cool decor, comfortable and delicious vegan Jamaican food and fresh juices
Adorable place. Food exquisite. Owner is lovely. I will be a frequent patron.

Amazing food. Owner is very cool and friendly. Well worth the wait, which to me wasn't even long for a full meal worth of vegan food that tasted healthy and delicious. The service was great. Would def come back down from Laurel, MD to eat there again!
Small place, excellent service absolutely delicious food & smoothies, Jamaican Vegan food done great ! I'm glad I finally got to visit 😍

This super cute restaurant is absolutely amazing! My boyfriend and I were just cruising the neighborhood and decided to try their desserts.  I’m certainly not vegan and if you would have told me that the carrot cake and lemon cupcake were vegan I would have not believed you one bit. Each cake was deliciously moist with the perfect amount sweetness. I also highly recommend the strawberry mango smoothie with pineapple juice. I definitely will be back!
Clean & Friendly Environment with good tasting food..be patient tho!

Beautiful neighborhood spot for tasty vegan Jamaican food. Tasty food and friendly and authentic staff make for an enjoyable experience. It's a fast casual experience which has pictures, art, and music from Jamaican culture.  The chickpea curry is tasty, and the red cabbage salad is satisfyingly spicy (not too spicy) and is not creamy or oily. Would get this again.
Jerk chicken meatless new experiences good flavor filling fresh pineapple ginger juice on on point lemon cake was delicious will return soon
Great place to enjoy Jamaican vegan food!
Laid back atmosphere and very tasty food. Nice big window to sit at and watch the Georgia Ave. comings and goings.

Lois is amazing, and her kind personality is poured into her dishes. We are always greeted with a smile and warm welcome. We love to have her coconut curry chickpeas, chickpea burger and lentil soup. After trying those dishes we just couldn’t get away from them! Sweet Sosumba has a soothing aroma as soon as you walk through the doors. It’s a refreshing feeling we get when visiting and our appetites are always satisfied.
(Translated by Google) Loved the sauce jerekey  (Original) Loved the jerekey sauce
So far I've tried the chick pea curry, the jerk patty, and the ital stew and I only started coming here this week! The food is great and the service is friendly and helpful.

Been looking for a place like this for awhile. The owner is the sweetest and the food is delicious. I had never even had Jamacian food prior to being vegan and it was an amazing introduction. The first time I went was with a non-vegan Jamacian just to help me order, and they were just as impressed with the quality and authenticity as I was!

As a long time vegan and lover (and maker) of Caribbean food I was super excited to try this place. If you are thinking that the food will taste like traditional soul touching jamaican food that just happens to be vegan... wrong! This is some gentrified version of jamaican food...they should say "inspired," or "influenced." For what it was the food was pretty and good, as in "wholesome and filling," it just wasn't what I went there to get. The food just wasn't flavorful and even the sorrel was watered down. I will try it again but probably opt for the smoothies and such rather than a meal. Oh, the lady was really nice that worked there but she could definitely use some support. As more folks walked in she's trying to balance the register, making the food, taking online/phone orders, and keeping tables clean. That's too much for one person, the wait time would be much less if she had some help.
I'm so happy to have more plant based restaurants in DC! The food was delicious (I had the coconut curry chickpeas and jerk chicken), and the pineapple ginger juice was so great!

OMGGGGG!!! Sweet Sosumba Vegan Jamaican Restaurant is truly a hidden gem. The food is super delicious and satisfying. The quality and taste of the food is absolutely outstanding. My first visit - I ordered the coconut curry chickpea dinner with rice and peas and cabbage. The meal was just delish. Let me tell you - I had dreams about getting more of that coconut curry chickpea meal in my palates. My return visit today - I ordered the jerk chickun meal with peas and rice with cabbage. One word: Outrageously delicious. And, to top it off, I purchased a vegan lemon cupcake and brownie for my non-vegan daughters who could not stop raving in disbelief that these sweet treats were vegan. I say all of this to say that - If you are in the area or have access to UberEats or PostMates, please treat yourself to this place. The cherry on top: The staff/owners are very friendly and pleasant. I will keep coming back as long as they stand.
Begin your meal with an avocado smoothie. End it with a sweet potato cake.
(Translated by Google) Excellent food and amazing people  (Original) Excelente food and amazing people
Good customer service and tasty affordable food. They do deliveries, so some things are ready faster than others. Will come back.
Everything on the menu is amazing! Definitely try anything made with chickpeas because she knows how to make them right!

I was so excited to try this place as I love Jamaican food and I am working on becoming a vegan. Now I regret even wasting my time and money there. I waited for my food close to 2 hours, and after waiting for one hour I was told that they ran out of rice and peas so I had to get plain brown rice. After finally receiving my food I noticed the portions were very small, rice was extremely dry. After waiting so long for the food, I expected it to taste good but it was just bland. I ordered a pina colada smoothie and I got something that had the consistency of juice. I will not be going back to this restaurant; this restaurant has been the worst restaurant I have ever been to. I wish I could give 0 stars.
The food delicious and the service was excellent. We had a great time. אוכל טבעוני מעולה ומזין. אחלה שירות!
The only vegan spot I trust right now in DC .. non-soy food.. the best

Excellent food, extremely clean interiors, great vibe and aesthetic. Super friendly staff and everything was made from scratch. Places like these need your support and business –  this is a worthy visit even if it is out of your way.  The boss lady is extremely environmentally conscientious, too. We asked for a “zero disposables” meal, which she was more than kind enough to offer. Even the way she offered us sauces... added them on a saucer instead of disposable plastic bowls.  Please dine here and request for durables. #DoGoodBeGood
This place is actually pretty nice. Will come here again.
Try this spot for lunch today great new edition to vegan dc world.
Delicious food! The owner was very friendly and welcoming. Welcome to the neighborhood!  Not only is the jamaican cuisine vegan but it’s soy free! Which is a major thumbs up for vegan food.

Best authentic vegan food in DC! A great variety of options, from fresh juices to hot entres made on the site - everything is impressive and seasoned well. This is what vegan food should taste like. Would recommend to anyone looking for unprocessed and authentic vegan foods at an affordable price - and everything is SOY FREE!
I tried the coconut curry chickpea and the ital jerk stew and it was excellent! Very nice restaurant, good vibes, and healthy tasty food.
